title: Fetch meteo data of DWD weather stations — read.DWDdata
text: id integer. valid station id (cf. read.DWDstations). type string. Stations can type "climate" offering range meteorological parameters type "precipitation" solely recording rainfall. 400 climate 2000 precipitation stations. period string specifying time span. last 1.5 years called "recent". Data individual beginning measurements year ago labelled "historical". "recent" data yet gone full quality control procedure. "historical" data completed operational quality control. aware still might gaps inhomogeneities. resolution string. Temporal resolution data can "daily" "monthly". "daily" common resolution. file string specifying location dataset. "file" may point file FTP server local file system. file lives FTP server string must start 'ftp://'. NULL (default), data downloaded DWD's FTP server. destdir directory (string) intermediate data (downloaded *.zip file) stored. NULL (default) subdirectory downloaded_packages session temporary directory used (files deleted end session). might advisable keep .zip file since contains stations documentation metadata (e.g. station shift, used devices, downtimes etc.). quiet TRUE, suppress status messages (), progress bar.

title: Determine vegetation period — vegperiod
code: vegperiod(   dates,   Tavg,   start.method,   end.method,   Tsum.out = FALSE,   species = NULL,   est.prev = 0 )

title: Determine vegetation period — vegperiod
text: dates vector calendar dates (objects class Date something understood .Date). Must contain entire years est.prev > 0 else first year may comprise November December. Tavg vector daily average air temperatures degree Celsius. length dates. start.method name method use vegetation start. One "Menzel" (needs additional argument species, see ), "StdMeteo" resp. "ETCCDI", "Ribes uva-crispa". Can abbreviated (partial matching). discussion see Details. end.method name method use vegetation end. One "vonWilpert", "LWF-BROOK90", "NuskeAlbert" "StdMeteo" resp. "ETCCDI". Can abbreviated (partial matching). discussion see Details. Tsum.boolean. Return sum day degrees within vegetation period. species name tree species [required start.method='Menzel'        ignored otherwise]. Must one "Larix decidua", "Picea abies (frueh)",        "Picea abies (spaet)", "Picea abies (noerdl.)",        "Picea omorika", "Pinus sylvestris", "Betula        pubescens", "Quercus robur", "Quercus petraea",        "Fagus sylvatica". est.prev number years estimate previous year's        chill days first year        [required start.method='Menzel' ignored otherwise]. Menzel requires number chill days previous November        December. est.prev = 0 first year used get        previous year's chill days dropped afterwards. Thus, year        time series lost. avoid losing year,        est.prev = n estimates previous year's chill days        first year average n first years time series.

title: Determine vegetation period — vegperiod

title: Determine vegetation period — vegperiod
text: method "Menzel" implements algorithm described Menzel (1997). method parameterized 10 common tree species. needs previous year's chill days. "ETCCDI" resp. "StdMeteo" simple threshold based procedure defined Expert Team Climate Change Detection Indices (cf. ETCCDI 2009, Frich et al. 2002, Zhang et al. 2011) leading quite early vegetation starts. method widely used climate change studies. method "Ribes uva-crispa" based leaf-gooseberry (Janssen 2009). developed Germany's National Meteorological Service (Deutscher Wetterdienst, DWD) robust early starts common simple meteorological procedures.

title: Determine vegetation period — vegperiod
text: end method "vonWilpert" based von Wilpert (1990). originally developed "Picea abies" Black Forest commonly used tree species throughout Germany. usual, rules regarding soilmatrix neglected implementation. "LWF-BROOK90" -sake convenience- reimplementation LWF-BROOK90 VBA (version 3.4) variant "vonWilpert" (Hammel Kennel 2001). interpretation von Wilpert (1990) somewhat lower precision VBA mimicked. "NuskeAlbert" provide simple method inspired standard climatological procedures employs 7 day moving average 5 °C threshold (cf. Walther Linderholm 2006). "ETCCDI" resp. "StdMeteo" simple threshold based procedure defined Expert Team Climate Change Detection Indices (cf. ETCCDI 2009, Frich et al. 2002, Zhang et al. 2011) leading quite late vegetation ends.
